description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves to the position and deploys. If an enemy is detected in the area to defend, Unit will automatically try to neutralize it.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position to monitor and faces the danger direction. It will open fire only to self-protect.

mission.name: AirDefenseArtillery - defend area (from a position) (Short Range)
FieldArtillery - (Surveillance Detachment) - collect intelligence on objectives
FieldArtillery - (Long Range Surveillance Detachment) - collect intelligence on objectives
FieldArtillery - (Short Range Radar) - collect intelligence on objectives

description.doctrine: Route reconnaissance is a form of reconnaissance that focuses along a specific line of communication, such as a road, railway, or cross-country mobility corridor.
description.usage: Unit moves along the route reconnaissance. If an enemy is detected, Unit will engage it.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to dinamycally support and follows it. If this unit is engaged, Unit will engage the enemy to change the force ratio and/or destroy it.

description.doctrine: The action by land, air, or sea forces to protect by offense, defense, or threat of either or both.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position, installs and cover its allies by barring any enemy that could prevent the covered allies from fulfilling their missions.

description.doctrine: A security element operating to the flank of a moving or stationary force to protect it from enemy ground observation, direct fire, and surprise attack.
description.usage: Unit moves along a designated route while coordinating with its allies. Where necessary, it will fire upon enemies within weapons range. After reaching its objective, the unit assumes a defensive posture.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that physically renders an enemy force combat-ineffective until it is reconstituted.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted enemy and opens fire until it is operationally ineffective, or totally destroyed.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that captures an area
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted area and attacks units near the area, within a certain doctrine-defined distance

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to support, takes a support position that allows it to help this unit with fire, resources or movement, and follows it. If necessary, Unit will open fire.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task where a unit prevents the enemy from moving any part of his force from a specific location for a specific period of time.
description.usage: Unit moves towards an enemy and opens fire to prevent it from moving.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position to observe, stops when it has a good perception of this position and monitor the danger direction.

description.doctrine: A tactical task in which a force moves onto an objective, key terrain, or other manmade or natural terrain area and controls that entire area. The commander maintains physical influence over a specified area to prevent its use by an enemy.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the area to control, installs and controls the area, ie. detects and reduces any enemy present in the area. A unit controlling an area has a tactical advantage over its enemy units in this area.

description.doctrine: An element of assessment: continuous observation of the common operational picture to identify indicators of opportunities for success, threats to the force, and gaps in information.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position to monitor and faces the danger direction. It will open-fire only to self-protect.

description.doctrine: To divert, disrupt, delay, or destroy the enemy's surface military potential before it can be used effectively against friendly forces. It may include destruction, removal, contamination, or erection of obstructions.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position and will hold it at all costs, even if the force ratio is unfavorable.

description.doctrine: An offensive operation that destroys or defeats enemy forces, seizes and secures terrain, or both.
description.usage: Unit moves along the specified route and tries to inflict as much damage as possible to enemy units. After reaching its objective, the unit assumes a defensive posture.

description.doctrine: A mission undertaken to obtain, by visual observation or other detection methods, information about the activities and resources of an enemy or potential enemy.
description.usage: Unit moves towards a designated reconnaissance point. If an enemy is detected, Unit will engage it.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves along the route to scout. Unit will engage enemy units only as retaliation.

description.doctrine: A security element whose primary task is to observe, identify, and report information, and which only fights in self-protection.
description.usage: The unit will maintain a tactical stand-by position, facing the danger direction, and wait for enemy units. When an enemy unit is detected, the unit will move along the designated route to maintain visual contact on the enemy and avoid contact. Nevertheless, if Unit can, it will open fire as it progresses.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that involves taking possession of a designated area using overwhelming force.
description.usage: Unit moves towards an observation point relevant for its objective. If an enemy unit is in the area to seize, Unit will reduce it, else Unit will take position in the area and hold it.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to relieve and take its mission.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves along the route to open, with a lurking stance. Unit will engage enemy units only as retaliation.

description.doctrine: A form of defensive operation that involves organized movement away from the enemy, in which a force under pressure trades space for time by slowing the enemy?s momentum and inflicting maximum damage on the enemy without, in principle, becoming decisively engaged.
description.usage: The unit will maintain a tactical stand-by position, facing the danger direction, and wait for enemy units. When an enemy unit is detected, Unit engages it to stop its movement, then screens it before engage it again, and repeat the screen/engage cycle.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to escort and follows it. Unit will engage any detected enemy unit. If the unit to follow has a move mission, this unit will stop and wait for Unit. When close to it, Unit will take its objective and move towards this objective, followed by the unit to escort.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Instead of one unit, Unit will escort all sub-units of the selected company-level automat.

description.doctrine: A checkpoint is a predetermined point on the ground used to control movement, tactical maneuver, and orientation.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position of the checkpoint, builds (if not already done) and operates it. A checkpoint is effective only if it is operated by a unit. While operating a checkpoint, the unit can't fulfill other missions, but is still able to shoot, hide and emplace.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to support, takes the position and will engage any unit that engages the supported units.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves along the specified route and try to bypass, or else remove any detected obstacle. If Unit cannot remove a obstacle, it will wait for reinforcements.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves along the specified route and try to remove any detected obstacle. If Unit cannot remove a obstacle, it will wait for reinforcements.

description.doctrine: Engineer reconnaissance focuses on the requirements to clear obstacles or improve routes, fords, bridges, and so forth, to assist in the uninterrupted movement of the main body force.
description.usage: Unit moves along the specified route and tries to detect any present obstacle. If an obstacle is detected, Unit will try to avoid it.

description.doctrine: Engineer reconnaissance focuses on the requirements to clear obstacles or improve routes, fords, bridges, and so forth, to assist in the uninterrupted movement of the main body force.
description.usage: Unit moves to the specified area and tries to detect any present obstacle.

description.doctrine: Engineer reconnaissance focuses on the requirements to clear obstacles or improve routes, fords, bridges, and so forth, to assist in the uninterrupted movement of the main body force.
description.usage: Unit moves to the specified site and tries to reconnoiter it.

description.doctrine: An operation required before ground combat power can be projected and sustained across a water obstacle. It is a centrally planned and controlled offensive operation that requires the allocation of external crossing means and a force dedicated to the security of the bridgehead.
description.usage: Unit moves to the crossing site and operates it: Unit builds a pontoon bridge, then moves to the meeting point. This mission is available only if the site is reconnoitered first.

mission.name: Engineer - support a new crossing site

description.doctrine: A tactical task where any means available are employed to break through or secure a passage through an enemy defense, obstacle, minefield, or fortification.
description.usage: Unit moves to the obstacle, and removes it.

description.doctrine: A tactical task that involves maneuvering around an obstacle, position, or enemy force to maintain the momentum of advance. Bypassed obstacles and enemy forces are reported to higher headquarters.
description.usage: Unit moves to the obstacle and bypasses it. If the obstacle cannot be bypassed, Unit will try to remove it.

description.doctrine: A tactical task where any means available are employed to break through or secure a passage through an area.
description.usage: Unit moves to the area and remove any known obstacle.

description.doctrine: A mission in which one unit augments the capability of another similar-type unit.
description.usage: Reinforcing Unit moves to its target, and will support it in its future actions.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit performs the specified works, in the given order.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves to the working site and tries to resume the work.

description.doctrine: The development of terrain to enhance friendly mobility.
description.usage: Unit moves to the area to improve, and build a "mobility enhanced area"

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves to the obstacle to activate, activates it and improves it if possible.

description.doctrine: Route reconnaissance is a form of reconnaissance that focuses along a specific line of communication, such as a road, railway, or cross-country mobility corridor.
description.usage: Unit moves along the route to recon. If an enemy is detected, Unit will engage it.

description.doctrine: The action by land, air, or sea forces to protect by offense, defense, or threat of either or both.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position, installs and cover its allies by barring any enemy that could prevent the covered allies from fulfilling their missions.

description.doctrine: A tactical task to physically render an enemy force combat-ineffective unless it is reconstituted.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted enemy and opens fire to totally destroy it. Once the enemy unit destroyed, Unit will monitor the area.

description.doctrine: The action of a force that aids, protects, complements or sustains another force in accordance with a directive requiring such action.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to support, takes a support position that allows it to help this unit with fire, resources or movement and follows it. If necessary, Unit will open fire.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task where a unit prevents the enemy from moving any part of his force from a specific location for a specific period of time.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the enemy unit to fix and will open fire to prevent it from moving.

description.doctrine: A tactical task in which a force moves onto an objective, key terrain, or other manmade or natural terrain area and controls that entire area. The commander maintains physical influence over a specified area to prevent its use by an enemy.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the area to control and monitors the area. If possible, Unit lays mines on the main access to the area, and then controls the area, ie. detects and reduces any enemy present in the area. A unit controlling an area as a tactical advantage over its enemy units in this area.

description.doctrine: An element of assessment: continuous observation of the common operational picture to identify indicators of opportunities for success, threats to the force, and gaps in information.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the position to monitor and faces the danger direction. It will open-fire only to self-protect.

description.doctrine: An offensive operation designed to discover and/or test the enemy's strength or to obtain other information.
description.usage: Unit moves towards the point to recon. If an enemy is detected, Unit will engage it.

description.doctrine: A mission undertaken to obtain, by visual observation or other detection methods, information about the activities and resources of an enemy or potential enemy.
description.usage: Unit moves along the route to scout. Unit will engage enemy units only as retaliation.

description.doctrine: A tactical task which is oriented on the enemy to prevent, hinder, or delay the use of an area or route by enemy forces.
description.usage: Unit moves to a position that allow to open-fire on the position to deny, enhances it with obstacles and will hold it at all costs, even if the force ratio is unfavorable.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that involves taking possession of a designated area using overwhelming force.
description.usage: Unit moves towards an observation point relevant for its objective. If an enemy unit is in the area to seize, Unit will reduce it, else Unit will take position in the area and hold it.

description.doctrine: A form of the offense designed to develop the situation and to establish or regain contact.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted enemy and engages it if the force ratio is favorable.

description.doctrine: A tactical task to occupy and hold a terrain feature to ensure that it is free of enemy occupation or use.
description.usage: Unit moves to the position to hold, enhances it with obstacles and will hold it at all costs, even if the force ratio is unfavorable.

description.doctrine: A surprise attack by fire from concealed positions on a moving or temporarily halted enemy.
description.usage: Unit moves to the ambush position, enhances it with obstacles and takes a firing position. When the targeted enemy is engaged in the obstacle, Unit will open fire and take contact, then withdraw to the meeting point.

mission.name: Infantry - assist units in their rearward maneuvers
Imagery Intelligence - report information (real time UAV)
Asymetric - carry out a bombing (against a crowd)
Asymetric - carry out an attack (against armed forces)

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves to the target, activates the bomb and moves to the meeting point.

mission.name: Asymetric - carry out a dirty bombing attack

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves to the target, carries out the attack and moves to the meeting point.

description.doctrine: Follow the head of a blob population
description.usage: Follow the head of a blob population

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that reconnoiters an area.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted area and follows the vertices of the parameter area.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that reconnoiters an area but trying to avoid enemies.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted area and follows the vertices of the parameter area, trying to avoid enemies.
Withdraws to initial position of unit.

description.doctrine: TBC
description.usage: Unit moves towards the unit to escort and follows it. Unit will engage any detected enemy unit. If the unit to follow has a move mission, this unit will stop and wait for Unit. When close to it, Unit will take its objective and move towards this objective, followed by the unit to escort.

description.doctrine: Move to the specified arson fire and start to extinguish it with it available effective resources.
description.usage: Move to the specified arson fire and start to extinguish it with it available effective resources.

description.doctrine: Emergency Alert is a communication warning mechanism that emergency services can use to send alerts to communities
description.usage: The unit patrol within the provided area to deliver an emergency warning message. Alerted population would be more disposed to respond to evacucation or containment

description.doctrine: Animate the supply point and distribute resources held by it.
description.usage: Animate the supply point and distribute resources held by it. If the stock is empty moves toward the garage location except if it is required to wait.

description.doctrine: Population containement is an emergency procedure that requests people to not get out of their home.
description.usage: The target unit moves toward and setup a containment area. Population in this area is required to not move.

description.doctrine: The target unit moves toward and setup an evacuation area. Population in this area is required to move out the area. Units are not allowed to enter within the area
description.usage: The target unit moves toward and setup an evacuation area. Population in this area is required to move out the area. Units are not allowed to enter within the area

description.doctrine: The target unit moves toward and setup a secured area. Units can not enter within the area.
description.usage: The target unit moves toward and setup a secured area. Units can not enter within the area.

description.doctrine: The unit moves toward the specified location and setup a roadblock/checkpoint object. Traffic is filtered.
description.usage: The unit moves toward the specified location and setup a roadblock/checkpoint object. Traffic is filtered.

description.doctrine: Follow the head of a crowd
description.usage: Follow the head of a crowd

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that reconnoiters an area by force.
description.usage: Unit moves towards its targeted area and patrols it randomly until it fires upon an enemy. It then retreats to its initial position.

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that defends an area
description.usage: Unit moves towards a random point in the area, and, for engineering units, builds ditches in the area

description.doctrine: A tactical mission task that attacks an enemy or the nearest enemy
description.usage: Unit moves towards its target enemy and attacks it. It is possible to specify an ammunition which is to be used only once during the mission

description.doctrine: Fire support
description.usage: Targets enemy unit already targeted by friendly fire support, or enemy unit attacking a freindly unit, or enemy unit nearest a friendly unit, in this order

description.doctrine: Load the target victim, assess its current casualties and carry it to one appropriate hospital belonging to the provided hospitals list to unload it. Move back to the garage point at the end of the mission.
description.usage: Load the target victim, assess its current casualties and carry it to one appropriate hospital belonging to the provided hospitals list to unload it. Move back to the garage point at the end of the mission.

description.doctrine: Move to the specified location and search for perceived arson fire and start to extinguish it with it available effective resources.
description.usage: Move to the specified location and search for perceived arson fire and start to extinguish it with it available effective resources.

mission.name: ArmyAviation - assist flying unit in rearward maneuver

description.usage: If a Line of Departure (LD) is specified, Units will first move to this phase line, wait for the fragmentary order to cross the line, and then attack.
Units move to positions close to the Blocking Line (BL) and bar ennemies from taking them. When the force ratio becomes defavorable, Units move to the meeting point.
Units interdict near the specified Denial Line (DL)

While screening, Units try to keep a coherent formation to prevent any enemy infiltration. Yet, the screen concerns "big" enemy units only, thus some small units, like scout units, can breach the screen. In addition, Units will withdraw if they cross a Recognition and Reception Line (RRL) or a Handover Line (HL).
Units move to cover the area between the boundary limits and engage the enemy if the force ratio is favorable.

mission.name: Armor - report information on an axis
Armor - assist units in their rearward maneuvers
Infantry - assist units in their rearward maneuvers
Imagery Intelligence - report information (real time UAV)

description.doctrine: Operate fire units on provided locations and forward fire requests

description.usage: Move to where all units move to waypoints keeping the initial distance with the headquarter unit.

parameter.name: Ordre conduite changer regles engagement population

value.name: holding civilians in position by usage of non lethal means
dispersing civilians by active defense means

fragorder.name: Logistic - Manage remaining tasks before moving
